page.title: 04John Hughes
page.content: {John Hughes}was a gipsy. His grave is in the graveyard of St. John the Baptist Church in Itchen Abbas. John Hughes died on March 19th 1825 aged 26 years. That was 160 years ago.{He was {the last man in England to be hung for {horse stealing.}The owner of the stolen horse was the Rev Robert Wright, who arranged for the body to be buried in the graveyard. He was obviously a forgiving man. Bodies of criminals were usualy sent to a hospital for dissection.Doctors wanted corpses to find out about the human body.{He was hanged in {Winchester}and walked to the gallows wearing his best clothes with silver crowns for buttons. {On the gravestone is written "He is a {faithful friend,a father dear an {unfortunate husband lieth here".} Charlene Cooper JoAnn Wright
